definitions: To burn or char the surface of (something) with a sudden, intense heat.
To cause a sudden, painful burning sensation on the surface of (something).
To dry up or wither (plant tissue) with intense heat.
To brand (an animal) with a hot iron.
examples: Sear the scallops for two minutes on each side.
The hot pan will sear your fingers.
The sun can sear the leaves of delicate plants.
They used to sear cattle to mark them.
